name: Easy Red Chicken Enchiladas
author: Chef John
summary: Starting with a homemade red sauce, these Tex-Mex enchiladas are faster and easier to make than their Mexican forefathers, but still so delicious. This recipe makes 2 1/2 cups sauce, enough for 4 to 6 individual skillet enchiladas or 1 regular baking dish. Garnish with sour cream and guacamole.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste
3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more as needed
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Melt butter with olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat
Add onion and salt; cook and stir until onion starts to turn golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes
Stir in flour, chile powder, cumin, chipotle powder, black pepper, oregano, cayenne, and cinnamon
Cook and stir until fragrant, about 3 minutes
Add tomato paste and mix until fully combined
Pour in chicken broth and whisk until smooth
Increase heat to high and bring sauce to a simmer
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until flavors come together, about 10 minutes
Blend sauce with an immersion blender
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Heat a small cast iron skillet over medium-high heat
Heat tortillas until flexible, about 30 seconds per side
Cover the bottom of the skillet with a scoop of enchilada sauce
Place a tortilla on top and add 1/2 of the chicken, 1/3 of the Jack cheese, and 1/2 the cilantro and green onions
Spoon on more sauce and repeat layers, finishing with sauce and the remaining cheese
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts and sauce is bubbling, 10 to 15 minutes
